source:
%%sql
-- Build casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim table
-- Gets modified or deleted from source rows

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_new

     AS

-- gets data that matches of SourceID and flags that it is modified based on a row (md5) hash. Flags as "NewData"
-- gets data that is in the target but not in source. Flags as "DeletedData"

SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE
        WHEN T1.appealrefnumber IS NULL
        THEN T3.CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID
        ELSE NULL
    END                             AS CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID,
    T1.appealrefnumber              AS AppealRefNumber,
    T1.caseref                      AS CaseReference,
    T1.caseofficerlogin             AS CaseOfficerLogin,
    T1.caseofficername              AS CaseOfficerName,
    T1.email                        AS Email,
    T2.SourceSystemID,
    to_timestamp(T1.expected_from)  AS IngestionDate,
    NULL                            AS ValidTo,
    md5(
        concat(
            IFNULL(T1.appealrefnumber,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.caseref,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.caseofficerlogin,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.caseofficername,'.'),
            IFNULL(T1.email,'.')
        ))                          AS RowID, -- this hash should contain all the defining fields, so needs to be done
    'Y'                             AS IsActive,
    T3.IsActive                     AS HistoricIsActive

FROM odw_standardised_db.horizon_case_officer_additional_details T1
LEFT JOIN odw_harmonised_db.main_sourcesystem_fact T2 ON "Casework" = T2.Description AND T2.IsActive = 'Y'
FULL JOIN odw_harmonised_db.casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim T3 ON T1.appealrefnumber = T3.AppealRefNumber AND T3.IsActive = 'Y'
WHERE
    -- flags new data        
    (CASE
        WHEN T1.appealrefnumber = T3.AppealRefNumber AND 
            md5(
                concat(
                    IFNULL(T1.appealrefnumber,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.caseref,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.caseofficerlogin,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.caseofficername,'.'),
                    IFNULL(T1.email,'.')
            )) <> T3.RowID  -- same employee, changed data
            THEN 'Y'
            WHEN T3.AppealRefNumber IS NULL -- new PositionCode
            THEN 'Y'
        ELSE 'N'
        END  = 'Y' ) 
    AND T1.appealrefnumber IS NOT NULL
    AND T1.expected_from = (SELECT MAX(expected_from) FROM odw_standardised_db.horizon_case_officer_additional_details);
;

# Dataset is created that contains changed data and corresponding target data
- This script combines data that has been updated, Deleted or is new, with corresponding target data
- View **casework_all_appeals_new** is unioned to the target data filter to only those rows where changes have been detected
## View casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_changed_rows is created

%%sql
-- Create new and updated dataset

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_changed_rows

    AS

-- gets updated, deleted and new rows 
SELECT 
    CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID,
    AppealRefNumber,
    CaseReference,
    CaseOfficerLogin,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Email,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive

From casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_new WHERE HistoricIsActive = 'Y' or HistoricIsActive IS NULL

    UNION ALL

-- gets original versions of updated rows so we can update EndDate and set IsActive flag to 'N'
SELECT
    CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID,
    AppealRefNumber,
    CaseReference,
    CaseOfficerLogin,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Email,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
    
FROM odw_harmonised_db.casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim
WHERE AppealRefNumber IN (SELECT AppealRefNumber FROM casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_new WHERE CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID IS NULL) AND IsActive = 'Y';

%%sql

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW Loading_month

    AS

SELECT DISTINCT
    IngestionDate AS IngestionDate,
    to_timestamp(date_sub(IngestionDate,1)) AS ClosingDate,
    'Y' AS IsActive

FROM casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_new;

CREATE OR REPLACE TEMPORARY VIEW casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_changed_rows_final

    AS

SELECT 
    CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID,
    AppealRefNumber,
    CaseReference,
    CaseOfficerLogin,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Email,
    T1.SourceSystemID,
    T1.IngestionDate,
    T1.ValidTo,
    T1.RowID,
    T1.IsActive,
    T2.ClosingDate
FROM casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_changed_rows T1
FULL JOIN Loading_month T2 ON T1.IsActive = T2.IsActive

# View casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_changed_rows is used in a merge (Upsert) statement into the target table
- **WHEN MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key (i.e. AllAppealsID), EndDate is set to today -1 day and the IsActive flag is set to 'N'
- **WHEN NOT MATCHED** ON the surrogate Key, insert rows
## Table odw_harmonised_db.casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim is updated

%%sql
-- merge into dim table

MERGE INTO odw_harmonised_db.casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim AS Target
USING casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim_changed_rows_final AS Source

ON Source.CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID = Target.CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID

-- For Updates existing rows

WHEN MATCHED
    THEN 
    UPDATE SET
    Target.ValidTo = to_timestamp(ClosingDate),
    Target.IsActive = 'N'

-- Insert completely new rows

WHEN NOT MATCHED 
    THEN INSERT (
        CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID,
        AppealRefNumber,
        CaseReference,
        CaseOfficerLogin,
        CaseOfficerName,
        Email,
        SourceSystemID,
        IngestionDate,
        ValidTo,
        RowID,
        IsActive)
    VALUES (
        Source.CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID,
        Source.AppealRefNumber,
        Source.CaseReference,
        Source.CaseOfficerLogin,
        Source.CaseOfficerName,
        Source.Email,
        Source.SourceSystemID,
        Source.IngestionDate,
        Source.ValidTo,
        Source.RowID,
        Source.IsActive)

# Fix the IDs
- No auto-increment feature is available in delta tables, therefore we need to create new IDs for the inserted rows
- This is done by select the target data and using INSERT OVERWRITE to re-insert the data is a new Row Number
## Table odw_harmonised_db.casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim is updated

%%sql
-- Insert new casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim

INSERT OVERWRITE odw_harmonised_db.casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim

SELECT 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID NULLS LAST) AS CaseOfficerAdditionalDetailsID,
    AppealRefNumber,
    CaseReference,
    CaseOfficerLogin,
    CaseOfficerName,
    Email,
    SourceSystemID,
    IngestionDate,
    ValidTo,
    RowID,
    IsActive
FROM odw_harmonised_db.casework_case_officer_additional_details_dim;
